p: The result of the cytotoxic docking study of five phytoconstituents of M. peguensis has been presented in Table 6. The lanceolatin – B showed the upmost docking score (−6.32 kcal/mol) and the lowest score (−4.83 kcal/mol) was observed for pongamol. Lanceolatin – B binds with the protein tyrosine kinase (PDB: 1XKK) through a series of a bond via the residue named lys745, val726, leu844, ala743, met793, and leu718 in Fig. 6, Fig. 7, Fig. 8.
